topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a8852a6368723658c20000#post_54a8852a6368723658c20000
I doubt it; it looks more like something is physically wrong with his computer.



Speaking of anime I read up on a good theory someone made about the anime fandom recently.  Well after Naruto's ended ecchi and hentai seems to be making a bounce back.  Obviously Boku no hero academia is popular, but it's no Naruto popularity wise and if you ask your average street goer what they know about hero academia they won't know what the hell you're talking about.  What I mean by this is that Naruto's over, Bleach has lost most of it's popularity, dragonball *as a tv show* is over and such there's nothing to fill the gap so theoretically everything is going back to how it was before those franchises came about with hentai and ecchi being king.
